item.title: iPhone X Tips
item.description:
1) Fast(er) access to the multi-tasking switcher. Pull up from the bottom less than an inch, hesitate, then lift your finger from the screen. It is ‚Äúpull up and lift finger‚Äù rather than a ‚Äúflicking upward‚Äù gesture. Also, you don‚Äôt need to wait for the haptic feedback.

2) You can still Force quit apps in the multitasker. First enter the multi-tasking view, then hold down on any of the apps. A red circle will appear in the top left of each app screen. You can tap the red circle or swipe up on the app screen to force quit each app. I don‚Äôt recommend force quitting any apps regularly. This should only be used in situations where you believe a particular app is misbehaving (i.e. Facebook). Force quitting all apps does not improve battery life. In fact, it reduces battery life by requiring more processing to start rather than resuming apps.

3) Animoji doesn‚Äôt work in the dark.

4) You can take a screenshot by pushing either volume button and the power button at the same time. Editing or sharing screenshots is awesome in iOS 11. Try it!

5) If you hold down the top volume button and the power button at the same time for 2-3 seconds it will lock the phone and disable all biometric authentication (Face ID and Touch ID). Some call this the Police hold because you can activate it while handing your phone to an officer. Once activated only the passcode can unlock the phone.

Face ID 1) Works in bright light or darkness just as well as indoor lighting. 2) Requires being right side up to work; It doesn‚Äôt work sideways or upside down. 3) It needs to be 8‚Äù - 24‚Äù from your face to work consistently. 4) The best way to use Face ID is to pretend that your phone doesn‚Äôt have a passcode or Touch ID. Just tap the screen to wake the phone and then swipe up to go to the home screen or the previously used app.
